definitions: crown or top part of a person's head
examples: His bald pate gleamed under the bright lights
She patted the baby's soft pate gently

definitions: person who has been granted a patent for an invention
examples: The patentee must pay annual renewal fees to maintain protection
Several patentees have challenged the new regulation in court

definitions: practice of limiting people's freedom for their own good in a fatherly way
examples: Corporate paternalism provided workers with housing but restricted their choices
Critics argued the law represented government paternalism at its worst

definitions: state of being someone's biological father
source or origin of something like an idea or creation
examples: The paternity test confirmed he was the biological father
He established paternity through DNA testing last year
Several scholars dispute the paternity of this ancient text
The paternity of the innovative design remains unclear

definitions: person who discovers new routes through unexplored territory
someone who develops new methods or ideas in any field
examples: The pathfinder marked trees to guide the expedition party
Native American pathfinders helped early settlers navigate westward
She became a pathfinder in sustainable architecture design
The company hired pathfinders to explore emerging market opportunities

definitions: bacterium, virus, or other microorganism that can cause disease in living organisms
examples: Scientists identified a new pathogen responsible for the outbreak
Hospital staff must follow protocols to prevent pathogen transmission

definitions: medical doctor who studies diseases by examining body tissues and fluids to diagnose conditions
examples: The pathologist examined tissue samples under the microscope carefully
A forensic pathologist determined the cause of death yesterday

definitions: scientific study of diseases and their causes, effects, and nature
abnormal or unhealthy condition in a person, group, or situation
examples: She specialized in cardiac pathology during her medical training
The pathology report revealed cancer cells in the tissue
The documentary explored the pathology of addiction in modern society
His behavior showed signs of serious psychological pathology

definitions: track or path designed for walking from one place to another
series of actions or stages leading to a particular outcome
examples: The stone pathway led through the garden to the pond
Children rode bicycles along the pathway every afternoon
The career pathway requires completing specific training modules first
Researchers discovered a new neural pathway in the brain

definitions: thin layer that forms on copper, bronze, or similar metals through age or weathering
appearance or aura that something acquires through age, use, or experience
examples: The statue developed a green patina over many decades
Collectors value the natural patina on antique bronze pieces
Years of use gave the leather chair a beautiful patina
The old bookstore had a patina of scholarly tradition

definitions: paved outdoor area adjoining a house used for dining or relaxation
examples: We enjoyed breakfast on the sunny patio every morning
They installed a new stone patio behind their house

definitions: regional dialect that differs from the standard language of a country or area
examples: The fishermen spoke in a local patois difficult to understand
Jamaican patois combines English with African language influences

definitions: male head of a family or tribal line who rules with authority
bishop or leader of certain Christian churches, especially Eastern Orthodox
examples: The patriarch made all important decisions for the extended family
Four generations gathered to celebrate the patriarch's ninetieth birthday
The patriarch blessed the congregation during the Easter service
Orthodox Christians recognize several patriarchs across different regions

definitions: office, tenure, or jurisdiction of a patriarch in religious or social contexts
examples: The patriarchate extended across several countries in Eastern Europe
He studied the history of the Moscow Patriarchate extensively

definitions: social system in which men hold primary power and predominate in roles of leadership and authority
examples: Feminist scholars analyze how patriarchy shapes social institutions today
The novel critiques patriarchy in nineteenth-century British society

definitions: member of the nobility or aristocracy, especially in ancient Rome
examples: The patrician families controlled most of the city's wealth
Her patrician bearing revealed her upper-class background immediately

definitions: property or rights inherited from one's father or male ancestors through generations
examples: He squandered his patrimony on risky business ventures foolishly
The castle formed part of the family's ancient patrimony

definitions: person who vigorously supports their country and is prepared to defend it
examples: Patriots gathered to celebrate the nation's independence day together
She considered herself a patriot who questioned government policies

definitions: devoted love, support, and defense of one's country and national interests
examples: His patriotism inspired him to join the military service
Schools taught patriotism through flag ceremonies and national songs

definitions: police officer who patrols a specific area on foot or in a vehicle
examples: The patrolman walked his beat through the neighborhood daily
A patrolman responded to the emergency call within minutes

definitions: regular customer of a store, restaurant, or other establishment
person who gives financial support to a person, organization, or cause
examples: The restaurant's loyal patrons filled every table on weekends
Library patrons can borrow up to ten books at once
The wealthy patron funded the museum's new sculpture exhibit
Artists sought patrons to support their creative work financially

definitions: support given by customers to a business through regular purchases
system of appointing people to positions as rewards for political support
examples: The shop thrived thanks to local patronage over many years
We appreciate your patronage and hope you'll visit again
Political patronage filled government offices with unqualified party supporters
The patronage system rewarded loyalty rather than merit or skill

definitions: person easily taken advantage of or blamed for something they didn't do
examples: They made him the patsy for their failed business scheme
Don't be a patsy for someone else's mistakes or crimes

definitions: rapid continuous talk, especially of a salesperson or entertainer
quick light sounds like rain or footsteps hitting a surface
examples: The auctioneer's patter kept bidders engaged throughout the sale
Stand-up comedians perfect their patter through countless performances
Rain patter on the roof lulled everyone to sleep peacefully
The patter of tiny feet announced the toddler's arrival

definitions: small flat cake of chopped food, especially meat formed into a round shape
examples: She grilled burger patties for the backyard barbecue party
The recipe calls for shaping the mixture into small patties

definitions: presence of something only in small or insufficient quantities or amounts
examples: The paucity of evidence made prosecution difficult in court
A paucity of qualified teachers affects rural school districts

definitions: very poor person who depends on charity or public welfare for survival
examples: The economic crisis turned many workers into paupers overnight
Victorian laws distinguished between deserving and undeserving paupers harshly

definitions: hard surface covering for roads, sidewalks, or other areas
examples: The new pave improved drainage along the busy street
Workers laid fresh pave in the shopping center parking lot

definitions: hard surface of a road or street made of concrete or asphalt
raised paved area beside a road for pedestrians to walk on
examples: Heavy trucks damaged the pavement during construction work yesterday
The hot pavement burned through her thin shoe soles
Children drew hopscotch squares on the pavement with chalk
Cafes placed tables on the wide pavement for outdoor dining

definitions: light ornamental building used for pleasure or entertainment in parks or gardens
large tent or temporary structure used for exhibitions or public events
examples: The wedding reception took place in the garden pavilion
A Victorian pavilion overlooked the lake in the park
Companies displayed products in the technology pavilion at the fair
The medical pavilion provided first aid during the festival

definitions: material used to form a hard level surface for roads, paths, or driveways
examples: The contractor recommended stone paving for the garden path
New paving transformed the appearance of the town square

definitions: foot of an animal that has claws or nails, especially mammals
examples: The cat cleaned its paw after walking through mud
Bear paws left deep prints in the soft ground

definitions: least powerful chess piece that moves forward one square
person used by others for their own purposes without regard
examples: She moved her pawn forward to begin the chess game
Protecting pawns becomes crucial in the endgame strategy
Employees felt like pawns in the corporate merger negotiations
Don't be a pawn in someone else's political games

definitions: shop where people can borrow money by leaving valuable items as security
examples: He pawned his watch at the local pawnshop for cash
The pawnshop displayed guitars and jewelry in the window

definitions: written order or note that requires payment of a specified amount
examples: The accountant processed all payables before the month ended
Outstanding payables appeared on the company's balance sheet clearly

definitions: act of revenge or retaliation for a wrong or injury
period required for an investment to generate enough income to recover its cost
examples: His cruel prank was payback for last year's embarrassment
They sought payback against those who had betrayed them
The solar panels have a payback period of seven years
Investors calculated payback before committing to the project

definitions: regular payment of wages or salary received from an employer for work done
examples: She deposited her paycheck at the bank every Friday
Living paycheck to paycheck left no room for emergencies

definitions: regular day on which wages or salaries are paid to employees
examples: Workers eagerly anticipated payday at the month's end
Bills piled up while waiting for the next payday

definitions: person or organization that pays money for goods, services, or obligations
examples: Insurance payers must approve procedures before treatment begins sometimes
The payer submitted payment through the online portal yesterday

definitions: carrying capacity of an aircraft or spacecraft excluding operational equipment
explosive warhead carried by a missile or similar weapon
examples: The rocket's payload included three communication satellites for orbit
Cargo planes increased payload capacity for international shipping routes
Military analysts assessed the missile's payload and range capabilities
The payload detonated precisely at the predetermined target location

definitions: official who is responsible for paying wages or salaries to employees
examples: The paymaster distributed wages to workers every Friday afternoon
Military paymasters ensured soldiers received their pay promptly

definitions: final payment that completes a transaction or debt
money paid to someone to influence their actions illegally
profit or advantage gained from an action or investment
examples: The mortgage payoff freed them from monthly housing payments
She requested the loan payoff amount from the bank
Police discovered payoffs to officials in the corruption scandal
The executive accepted payoffs to approve questionable contracts
Years of practice showed a payoff in her performance
The risky investment had a huge payoff eventually

definitions: list of employees and their wages that a company must pay regularly
examples: The company added fifty workers to its payroll last quarter
Processing payroll requires careful attention to tax regulations

definitions: abbreviated form of the word percent used in writing
examples: Sales increased by 15 pct over the previous year
The report showed a 3 pct decline in unemployment

definitions: small round green seed eaten as a vegetable, growing in pods on climbing plants
examples: She added fresh peas to the spring vegetable soup
Children pushed peas around their plates at dinner time

definitions: person, especially a soldier, who helps maintain peace in areas of conflict
examples: UN peacekeepers patrolled the border between the warring nations
The peacekeeper negotiated a ceasefire between rival factions successfully

definitions: use of international forces to prevent or end conflicts between nations or groups
examples: The peacekeeping mission lasted for over two years successfully
Nations contributed troops to peacekeeping efforts in the region

definitions: person who brings about peace, especially by reconciling adversaries or settling disputes
examples: She acted as peacemaker between the feuding neighbors successfully
The diplomat earned recognition as an international peacemaker
